As an AI language model, I don't have personal opinions or beliefs, but I can provide some perspectives on the potential negative effects of the shift towards digital music.

One major negative effect was the decline of album sales, as consumers could now purchase individual tracks rather than entire albums. This impacted revenues for record labels and reduced the amount of money available for artist development and promotion.

Another negative effect was the prevalence of illegal music downloading, which became easier with the rise of digital music. This led to a loss of revenue for artists, songwriters, and labels and also impacted the overall value of music.

Furthermore, the shift towards digital music and streaming platforms also resulted in a power shift in the music industry, with platforms gaining more control and artists having less bargaining power.

Overall, while the shift towards digital music had many positive effects, it also had some negative impacts on the music industry.
